newsitem.title: GERMANY: BOXING-GERMAN ROCCHIGIANI USED BANNED DRUG IN TITLE BOUT.
newsitem.headline: BOXING-GERMAN ROCCHIGIANI USED BANNED DRUG IN TITLE BOUT.

text.p: German boxer Graciano Rocchigiani tested positive for a banned drug when he lost to compatriot Dariusz Michalczewski in a controversial World Boxing Organisation (WBO) light-heavyweight title bout last August, German doping officials said on Tuesday.
Traces of the banned stimulant ephedrine were found in Rocchigiani's urine after the fight in Hamburg on August 10, said Wilhelm Schaenzer, head of Cologne's respected drug-testing laboratory.
Rocchigiani, who is due to fight American John Scully in a non-title fight in Berlin on Saturday, faces a possible three-month ban.

But Schaenzer was very critical of the way boxing authorities had handled the affair since the B-test -- the second examination of the urine which is used to confirm the presence of the drug -- has yet to be analysed.
"The B-test has to be concluded within three months. I told the German professional boxing association (BDB) about the test with plenty of time," Schaenzer told a news conference.
"When I asked about it again they told me it was with the international federation."
BDB officials were not immediately available to comment on the affair on Tuesday.
Rocchigiani was angry with the fight verdict and lodged an appeal after the bout ended in confusion.
Rocchiagiani, clearly ahead on points, landed a left hook which floored his fellow German in the seventh round, but the blow came after the referee had ordered the pair to break.
Rocchigiani said he did not hear the instruction. After 15 minutes of consultations, WBO officials declared Michalczewski the winner, to jeers and whistles from the crowd.
